definition: soldiers at the city walls (idiom); fig. at a critical juncture
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: After all, who wants your biggest rival pitching up on your doorstep?
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，谁又想让自己的最大竞争对手兵临城下呢？

definition: to dispatch an army/to send troops
the emperor leads his troops into battle (idiom)/to take part personally in an expedition
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
to attack for a long time without success
to advance on sth/to press closely (on some goal)
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
